actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce estate taxes on family-owned farm businesses and to exclude gain from the sale or exchange of a farming business to the extent of the medical expenses paid by the taxpayer.
short_title: Farmer Estate Tax Relief Act of 1997

summary.text: Farmer Estate Tax Relief Act of 1997 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from the gross value of an estate, for purposes of the estate tax, specified portions of the value of a qualified family-owned farm business. Provides for a limited (the lesser of certain qualified medical expenses or $500,000) one-time exclusion from gross income of the gain from the sale or exchange of certain qualified family-owned farm interests.

titles.title: Farmer Estate Tax Relief Act of 1997

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce estate taxes on family-owned farm businesses and to exclude gain from the sale or exchange of a farming business to the extent of the medical expenses paid by the taxpayer.
